newsitem.title: UK: NWE gas oil weaker, but buyers stay scarce.
newsitem.headline: NWE gas oil weaker, but buyers stay scarce.

text.p: NWE gas oil prices were weaker on Wednesday but trade was thin with volatile futures keeping buyers relaxed, traders said.

Bearish U.S. crude and gasoline stock builds sent futures markets tumbling in early trade and slack demand in Europe put pressure on barge and cargo differentials adding a further 50 cents to $1 to overall losses.

Traders said the API report for distillates was mildly bullish, showing a 1.1 million barrel draw in U.S. stocks, but benchmark gas oil futures fell around $3, tugged lower by weaker crude and NYMEX gasoline futures.
In the key ARA market brokers said supportive buying interest from one major was less evident today, adding to the general dearth of demand.
However, German inland traders said thin buying interest was fuelling strong competition for business and weaker ARA markets were allowing importers to remained competitive.
Premiums for prompt lifting barges eased around 50 cents to June IPE +50 cents/$1.50 a tonne fob Rotterdam with sellers of early June liftings heard around June IPE $1.50 a tonne fob ARA.
